item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec 2025 Results Reveal Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has unfolded with a nuanced picture across market capitalisations, reflecting a cautious yet improving corporate performance landscape. With 4,094 companies reporting results, the proportion of positive earnings has edged up modestly to 46.0%, signalling a gradual recovery from the subdued trends seen earlier in the year. Time: 5 minutes ago

item.title: Wardwizard Foods Declines 3.74%: Earnings and Valuation Challenges Shape Week
item.description: Wardwizard Foods & Beverages Ltd experienced a challenging week on the BSE, with its stock price declining 3.74% from ₹9.10 on 13 Feb 2026 to ₹8.76 on 20 Feb 2026, underperforming the Sensex which gained 0.39% over the same period. The week was marked by mixed trading sessions influenced by the company’s Q3 FY26 results revealing revenue growth but persistent profitability struggles, alongside a detailed valuation analysis highlighting elevated risk metrics and subdued market sentiment. Time: 49 minutes ago

item.title: Rallis India Gains 7.80%: Four Key Factors Driving This Week’s Momentum
item.description: Rallis India Ltd delivered a strong weekly performance, rising 7.80% from Rs.264.60 to Rs.285.25 between 16 and 20 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% gain over the same period. The stock’s trajectory was shaped by a series of technical momentum shifts, an upgrade in investment rating, and robust financial results, all contributing to renewed investor interest amid a mixed sector backdrop. Time: 49 minutes ago

item.title: Sangal Papers Gains 1.35%: Stabilisation and Valuation Shift Drive Weekly Performance
item.description: Sangal Papers Ltd closed the week at Rs.199.00, marking a 1.35% gain from the previous Friday’s close of Rs.196.35, outperforming the Sensex which rose 0.39% over the same period. The week was characterised by a stabilisation in the company’s quarterly financial performance, an upgrade in its investment rating from Strong Sell to Sell, and a notable improvement in valuation metrics amidst ongoing sector challenges. Despite sideways price movement midweek, the stock demonstrated resilience relative to the broader market, reflecting cautious investor sentiment amid mixed fundamental signals. Time: 49 minutes ago

item.title: Last Mile Enterprises Gains 2.06%: 2 Key Factors Driving the Week

item.title: Vishvprabha Ventures Declines 4.95%: Financial Struggles and Valuation Risks Weigh

item.title: HCL Technologies Declines 1.23% Amid Mixed Signals and Options Activity
